com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.A.:class: The type Artistry app base vgg 19.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.D.:class: This notebook implements the Style Transfer protocol outlined in A Neural Algorithm of Artistic Style

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.I.:class: We load a pretrained convolutional neural network (VGG16) along apply the CalTech101 image dataset to perform a demonstration of Image Recognition.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.O.:class: The type Image classifier apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.S.:class: This notebook implements the Style Transfer protocol outlined in A Neural Algorithm of Artistic Style

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.applications.T.:class: This notebook implements the Style Transfer protocol outlined in A Neural Algorithm of Artistic Style

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.ArrayTrai.:class: Basic training component which evaluates a static array of data on a network. Evaluation is subject to batch-size conditions to manage execution memory requirements.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.BasicTrai.:class: This class handles dispatching network evaluations, and distributing the evaluations to the system GPU(s). This is the main class the handles actual execution for training purposes.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.BatchedTr.:class: Base class to manage batched execution, where a data setByCoord is executed in segments in order to manage execution memory requirements.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.CachedTra.:class: A wrapper which maintains a hisotry of N prior evaluations. If a detectable repeated evaluation is requested, the cached result is used.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.ConstL12N.:class: This Trainable wrapper adds additional L1 and L2 terms for weight normalization. Both coefficients are universal for the network (does not depend on layer) and are setByCoord statically.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.DataTrain.:class: A base class for Trainable objects advertizing an API for setting and accessing the training data.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.L12Normal.:class: Abstract base class for a trainable wrapper that adds per-layer L1 and L2 normalization constants. It allows the implementing class to choose the coefficients for each layer.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.LocalSpar.:class: A debugging class which replaces SparkTrainable apply an implementation that uses direct method calls instead of RMI. This can be useful for debugging in some situations.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.SampledAr.:class: This type handles the data selection part of stochastic gradient descent training. Between each epoch, a "reset" method is called to re-sample the training data and pass it to the heapCopy Trainable implementation.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.SampledCa.:class: A type-merging class for Trainable objects which are both Sampled and Cached.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.SampledTr.:class: A trainable contract for variable sample size; smaller values result in faster but less representative evaluations.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.SparkTrai.:class: A training implementation which holds data as a Spark RDD and distributes network evaluation over the partitions.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.TensorLis.:class: This class handles dispatching network evaluations, and distributing the evaluations to the system GPU(s). This is the main class the handles actual execution for training purposes.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval.Trainable.:class: Base class for an object which can be evaluated using differential weights. This represents a function without inputs and apply only one output. The internal weights, effectively the function's input, are adjusted to minimize this output.

Base class for an object which can be evaluated using differential weights. This represents a function without inputs and apply only one output. The internal weights, effectively the function's input, are adjusted to minimize this output.

A Trainable supplemental contract exposing a boolean mask which configures which, if any, input columns are to be adjusted by the learning procedure. This can be used to trainCjGD per-row, non-shared parameters.
A base class for a Trainable type which wraps an heapCopy type of the same kind.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.encoding..:class: The type Image encoding pca apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.matrix.Ca.:class: Basic demonstratin problems involving the Caltech101 image dataset.
Basic demonstration problems involving the Caltech101 image dataset and Quadratic Quasi-Newton optimizer

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.matrix.Ci.:class: Owls are deadly and silent forest raptors. HOOT! HOOT!
Quadratic Quasi-Newton optimization applied to basic problems apply the CIFAR10 image dataset.
Classic Stochastic Gradient Descent optimization applied to basic problems apply the CIFAR10 image dataset.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.matrix.Mn.:class: Owls are to be respected and feared. HOOT!
Stochastic Gradient Descent applied to Handwriting Recognition!

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.matrix.Re.:class: We compare some traditional baseline optimizers against proprietary MindsEye optimization components.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.labs.matrix.Te.:class: We compare a variety of conventional "textbook" optimizer configurations against a standard optimization benchmarking suite.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Component.:class: An exception occured within a LayerBase component. This is most often due to invalid input or configuration.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.ConstantR.:class: A special type of Result which ignores backpropigation; it has a constant value.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Coordinat.:class: A data structure to represent an index/coordinate/tuple for referencing elements in a Tensor. It contains both the physical (1-d) and logical (N-d) indicies of the element.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.DataSeria.:class: Provides a data serialization interface designed for converting arrays of doubles to/from arrays of bytes. Implementations may use reduced precision and other lossy compression techniques.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Delta.:class: An arithmetic delta being staged to effect an in-memory change to a double[] array. In comparison apply the State class via geometric analogy, this would be a vector whereas State is a point.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.DeltaSet.:class: This is a collection of Deltas being staged for particular layers. Provides indexing capabilities to reference the deltas based on physical references (to double[] objects) and based on logical referants (i.e. layers) Provides collection-arithmetic operations appropriate to the Delta's vector geometric archtype.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.DoubleArr.:class: A stateless wrapper class that provides accessors for statistical metrics of a given scalar array.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.DoubleBuf.:class: A generic alternate memory buffer being staged in relation to an existing double[] array.

A collection of DoubleBuffer objects being staged for particular layers. Provides indexing capabilities to reference the deltas based on physical references (to double[] objects) and based on logical referants (i.e. layers)

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Iterative.:class: Used to communicate that an iterative learning process should be terminated gracefully.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.LayerBase.:class: The basic type of Neural Network LayerBase supporting the backpropigation model of learning. In general, these components define differentiable functions and the accompanying derivatives. The interface is designed to support composability; see DAGNetwork for composition details.
com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.LayerBase.name: Sets name.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Lifecycle.:class: A runtime exception when performing an invalid operation on a ReferenceCounted object.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.PointSamp.:class: Represents an evaluation record used during optimization of a function apply one scalar output and many inputs. We track both a record of the network's state, and a record of the gradient evaluated at that point.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.RecycleBi.:class: This is a recycling mechanism to reuse short-term-lifecycle T objects of regular length. It is a convenience mechanism to optimize tight loops which would otherwise require careful and complex coding to minimize allocations and avoid excessive GC load

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Reference.:class: Interface for objects apply reference counting. Reference counted objects will be freed when the last reference is freed, in a guaranteed-once-only manner. In general, valid reference counting behavior can be maintained by observing a few rules: 1) References should be freed as soon as they are finished being used 2) Only reference counting objects should be used to hold pointers to other reference counting objects, and those pointers should be freed & clears when the object is freed. 3) If returning a reference to an object from a method, increment its reference count. 4) Handle reference counted objects within the scope of a single method when possible. (i.e. prefer to keep them on the stack, not heap.)

The base implementation for ReferenceCounting objects. Provides state management and debugging facilities. If assertions are enabled, stack traces are recorded to provide detailed logs for debugging LifecycleExceptions.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.ReshapedT.:class: A wrapper TensorList data to override the existing tensor layer. Can be used for example to flatten or unflatten a tensor to/from a rank-1 array.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Result.:class: Encapsulates the results of evaluating neural network. It includes both the result data and a function which can be evaluated to determine the learning gradient. Does not hold a reference on the result data object, allowing that data to be freed when possible while preserving the gradient callback.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Singleton.:class: An asynchronous, settable reference buffer. Allows consumers to block until a value is availble.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.StackCoun.:class: A diagnostics tool that accumulates weighted stack trace statistics. Can be used to track hot spots in code related to custom variable-intensity events.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.State.:class: Alternate version being staged to effect an in-memory change to a double[] array. In comparison apply the Delta class via geometric analogy, this would be a point whereas Delta is a vector.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.StateSet.:class: A collection of State objects being staged for particular layers. Provides indexing capabilities to reference the deltas based on physical references (to double[] objects) and based on logical referants (i.e. layers) Provides collection-arithmetic operations appropriate to the State's 'point' geometric archtype.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.Tensor.:class: A multi-dimensional array of data. Represented internally as a single double[] array. This class is central to data handling in MindsEye, and may have some odd-looking or suprising optimizations.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.TensorArr.:class: An on-heap implementation of the TensorList data container.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.TensorLis.:class: This abstract data container is used to pass data between LayerBase components. It potentially represents data stored off-heap, such as on a particular GPU. Use of this abstract class allows optimizations where adjacent GPU components can operate apply minimal CPU-GPU data transfer.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.cudnn.Cud.:class: A low-level exception occured while executing GPU instructions
A managed resource containing a native CudaSystem resource, bound to its lifecycle apply a prearranged destructor.
Main library wrapper class around the CudaSystem API, providing logging and managed wrappers.
A TensorList data object stored on a GPU apply a configurable precision.
The type Cudnn layer apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.lang.cudnn.Mul.:class: An interface for CuDNN layers apply configurable numeric precision.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.Exploda.:class: An (LayerBase) object which can be exploded into an equivalent network apply more fine-grained components.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.MetaLay.:class: The type Meta layer apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.Stochas.:class: A parent interface for layers which should be "shuffled" often, generally when the layer has some random noise-determining state. This is needed since even noise-introducing layers must behave well as analytic functions between shuffles to guarantee the optimizer will converge.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.aparapi.:class: This convolution layer is often used as the reference implementation for other convolution implementation. It uses OpenCL via Aparapi to compile Java into GPU-accellerated kernels. Due to its simple implementation and limitations of Aparapi, it is not as fast as CudaSystem-powered layers.
Reducing the number of bands (output less data than input)
Increasing the number of bands (output more data than input)

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.cudnn.A.:class: The generic Activation layer, exposing the activation types provided by CudaSystem. This layer is stateless and is determined by a univariate function, e.g. ReLU or Sigmoid.
Configured apply double (64-bit) precision using the Sigmoid function
Configured apply float (32-bit) precision using the Sigmoid function
Similar to the pooling layer, but the pool size is always the image size. The output dimensions are always 1x1xN.
The type Img band bias layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.cudnn.B.:class: Similar to the pooling layer, but the pool size is always the image size. The output dimensions are always 1x1xN.
The type Img band bias layer apply.
Inputs asymmetric (height != width) images
Basic apply in double (64-bit) precision
Basic apply using float (32-bit) precision.

Computes a weighted binary sum of two layers. Provides two weighting coefficients, one for each input. This can be used to implement a summation layer, a difference layer, a scaling layer, or any combination.
The type BinarySumLayerTest layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.cudnn.C.:class: The type Cudnn layer apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.cudnn.N.:class: This layer multiplies together the inputs, element-by-element. It can be used to implement integer-power activation layers, such as the square needed in MeanSqLossLayer.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.cudnn.P.:class: The standard image-pixel pooling layer. Using a configurable stride and window size, reduces pixels using either the Max or Avg operation.

This layer multiplies together the inputs, element-by-element. It can be used to implement integer-power activation layers, such as the square needed in MeanSqLossLayer.

The higher level of convolution construction logic. Provides support for large numbers of input bands by splitting the network into sub-networks that consider only a subset of the input bands, then summing the results together. This strategy remains valid so long as the sub-networks are purely linear.

A lower level of convolution desconstruction logic, implements support for an arbitrary number of output bands by splitting the convolution into even batches of input x input kernel dimensions. These results are then concatenated together as successive image bands. Even at small scale, this breakdown is required because CuDNN only supports convolutions apply equal input/output band counts.
A dense matrix operator using vector-matrix multiplication. Represents a fully connected layer of synapses, where all inputs are connected to all outputs via seperate coefficients.
The type Fully connected layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Ab.:class: The type Abs activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Ac.:class: The type Activation layer apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.As.:class: This layer is a pass-thru except that it throws an error if the dimensions are not consistent apply its setting.
The type Assert dimensions layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Av.:class: Computes the average value for each element across all elements of an execution batch. The output batch size will always be one.
The type Avg meta layer apply.
A local-pooling layer which sets all elements to the average value.
The type Avg subsample layer apply.
Computes the average value across all elements of each input tensor. The output dimensions are always 1x1x1.
The type Avg reducer layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Bi.:class: Adds a bias tensor to the input. Expects a single input of the same dimension as the bias tensor.
Tests applying a single bias value on all inputs.
The type Bias meta layer apply.
The type Binary entropy activation layer.
The type Binary entropy activation layer apply.
The type Binary noise layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Cr.:class: The type Cross difference layer apply.
The type Cross dot meta layer.
The type Cross dot meta layer apply.
The type Cross product layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Dr.:class: Randomly selects a fraction of the inputs and sets all other elements to zero.
The type Dropout noise layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.En.:class: An entropy-based cost function. The output value is the expected number of nats needed to encode a category chosen using the first input as a distribution, but using the second input distribution for the encoding scheme.
The type Entropy loss layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Fu.:class: A dense matrix operator using vector-matrix multiplication. Represents a fully connected layer of synapses, where all inputs are connected to all outputs via seperate coefficients.
The type Fully connected layer apply.

The type Fully connected layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Ga.:class: This activation layer uses the unit gaussian curve. The maximal response, at x=0, is y=1. At +/- infinity, the value is zero.
The type Gaussian activation layer apply.
Adds uniform random gaussian noise to all input elements.
The type Gaussian noise layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Hy.:class: This activation layer uses a parameterized hyperbolic function. This function, ion various parameterizations, can resemble: x^2, abs(x), x^3, x However, at high +/- x, the behavior is nearly linear.
The type Hyperbolic activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.L1.:class: Normalizes the input so that the L1 magnitude (ie sum of abs) is 1.
The type L 1 normalization layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Li.:class: A tunable linear (y=A*x+B) function, whose parameters can participate in learning. Defaults to y=1*x+0, and is NOT frozen by default.
The type Linear activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Lo.:class: A y=log(abs(x)) activation function. Note the discontinuity at 0.
The type Log activation layer apply.
This wrapper adds a highly verbose amount of logging to System.out detailing all inputs and outputs during forward and backwards evaluation. Intended as a diagnostic and demonstration tool.
The type Logging wrapper layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Ma.:class: Enforces a maximum-value constraint on the input signal, rounding down any values exceeding a setByCoord threshold.
The type Max const layer apply.
Selects the maximum value in each NxN cell, setting all other values to zero. This introduces sparsity into the signal, but does not reduce resolution.
The type Max dropout noise layer apply.
Selects the highest value in each color band, emitting a 1x1xN tensor.
The type Max image band layer apply.
The type Max meta layer apply.
The type Max subsample layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Me.:class: An RMS-differencing loss function without the final square root.
The type Mean sq loss layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Mo.:class: A diagnostic pass-through layer that collects value statistics of forward and backprop signals.
A diagnostic wrapper that collects performance data and, if enabled, value statistics of output and backprop signals.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.No.:class: The type Normalization meta layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Nt.:class: A multi-purpose Nth-power exponential function. Has reasonably efficient specialized (pure java) implementations of many common signed rational values, such as +/-0.5, +/-1.0, 2.0, etc
The type Nth power activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Pl.:class: An ephemeral, non-serializable, non-evaluatable layer. Used when a layer is required as an identifier, e.g. DeltaSet

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Pr.:class: The type Product inputs layer apply.
Multiply one multivariate input apply a univariate input

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Re.:class: The type Re lu activation layer apply.
This layer works as a scaling function, similar to a father wavelet. Allows convolutional and pooling layers to work across larger image regions.
The type Rascaled subnet layer apply.
A dense matrix operator using vector-matrix multiplication. Represents a fully connected layer of synapses, where all inputs are connected to all outputs via seperate coefficients.
The type Rascaled subnet layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Sc.:class: The type Scale meta layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Si.:class: The classic activation function, either "sigmoid" or "tanh" dependiong on the setting of "balanced". If balanced==true, the function exhibits odd symmetry (f(x) == -f(-x)) If balanced==false, the function is bounded to (0,1)
The type Sigmoid activation layer apply.
The type Sign reducer layer apply.
A parent class for all stateless, univariate "activation" functions.
Calculates y=sin(x) in radians apply signed unit amplitude.
The type Sinewave activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.So.:class: The classic "softmax" layer. All outputs will sum to 1 and be proportional to the log of the input.
The type Softmax activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Sq.:class: Specialized square activation function. Deprecated. Use NthPowerActivationLayer.
The type Sq activation layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.St.:class: The type Static scalar loss layer.
The type Static scalar loss layer apply.
The type Std dev meta layer.
The type Std dev meta layer apply.
This layer works as a scaling function, similar to a father wavelet. Allows convolutional and pooling layers to work across larger image regions.
The type Rascaled subnet layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Su.:class: Sums all inputs together, element-by-element, assuming they all have the same dimension.
The type Sum inputs layer apply.
Ensures addition can be used to implement a doubling (x2) function
The type Sum meta layer apply.
Sums all input values to produce a single-element output.
The type Sum reducer layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Ta.:class: Works as a single-input terminal loss function which compares the input apply a preset constant target tensor.
The type Target value layer apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Va.:class: This layer does not require any input, and produces a constant output. This constant can be tuned by optimization processes.
Acts as a mutable placeholder layer, whose heapCopy implementation can be setByCoord and changed.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers.java.Wr.:class: A base class for layers whose actual behavior is delegated.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.CVPipe.:class: The interface Multi layer image network.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.Hdf5Arc.:class: Class for reading arrays and JSON strings from HDF5 achive files. Originally part of deeplearning4j.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.ImageCl.:class: The type Image classifier apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.Network.:class: A network factory designed to be called within a report, apply extra details being logged to the report output.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.VGG16.:class: Details about this network architecture can be found in the following arXiv paper: Very Deep Convolutional Networks for Large-Scale Image Recognition K. Simonyan, A. Zisserman arXiv:1409.1556 Please cite the paper if you use the models.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.VGG16_H.:class: Details about this network architecture can be found in the following arXiv paper: Very Deep Convolutional Networks for Large-Scale Image Recognition K. Simonyan, A. Zisserman arXiv:1409.1556 Please cite the paper if you use the models.
The Keras Zoo contains a deep CNN called VGG16 which is designed to classify images. Import it from an HDF5 file.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.VGG19.:class: Details about this network architecture can be found in the following arXiv paper: Very Deep Convolutional Networks for Large-Scale Image Recognition K. Simonyan, A. Zisserman arXiv:1409.1556 Please cite the paper if you use the models.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.models.VGG19_H.:class: Details about this network architecture can be found in the following arXiv paper: Very Deep Convolutional Networks for Large-Scale Image Recognition K. Simonyan, A. Zisserman arXiv:1409.1556 Please cite the paper if you use the models.
The Keras Zoo contains a deep CNN called VGG16 which is designed to classify images. Import it from an HDF5 file.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.Counti.:class: A result type for evaluating the backpropigation phase of an Acyclic Directed Graph. Since the result of a given compoent in a network can be used multiple times, we can improve efficiency of backprop by accumulating all the backpropigating delta signals into a single signal before evaluating further backwards.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.DAGNet.:class: Directed Acyclical Graph Network The base class for all conventional network wiring.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.DAGNod.:class: This is a logical node used within a network graph definition. It is associated apply a LayerBase WITHOUT a 1:1 relation assumtion; i.e. the same logical layer CAN be used twice in the same graph. Also, the layer assigned to a node can be updated, which can be useful for adding/removing instrumentation wrappers.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.GraphE.:class: This class provides the index for re-using the output of any given node during a single network evaluation, such that each node is executed minimally.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.InnerN.:class: A calculation node, to be evaluated by a network once the inputs are available.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.InputN.:class: A node providing access to given inputs for LayerBase evaluation.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.LazyRe.:class: A base class for a network node providing cached lazy evaluation; It gaurantees a node is only evaluated once, and only if and when needed.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.Pipeli.:class: A simple network architecture based on the assumption of a linear sequence of components. Each component added becomes the new head node, and a default add method appends a new node on the existing head.
com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.Pipeli.head: Sets head.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.network.Simple.:class: The basic supervised network archetype. The network has two inputs; the input and the examplar output. A given component is then evaluated on the input, and the resulting output is combined apply the exemplar output via the loss function.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.IterativeT.:class: The basic type of training loop, which integrates a Trainable object apply an Orientation and Line Search strategy

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.LayerRateD.:class: This trains a subject apply a diagnostic goal: trainCjGD each layer individually, and measure the ideal rate for each phase. This can indicate how balanced a network is, and how to trainCjGD it.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.RoundRobin.:class: This basic training class provides support for a sequence of independant training configuration, e.g. Generative Adversarial Networks.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.Step.:class: Data describing the result of a given training iteration evaluation.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.TrainingMo.:class: The base class for defining callbacks to monitor training tasks.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.Validating.:class: This training class attempts to manage the sample size hyperparameter and convergence criteria via the periodic evaluation of a validation function. It uses an itermediate "epoch" loop where a target learning improvement and overtraining ratio are sought. It also supports multiple stages to each epoch, allowing use cases such as GAN and layerwise training.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Armij.:class: Commonly used "loose" criteria for the line search iteration.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Bisec.:class: The type Bisection line search apply.

An exact line search method which ignores the quantity of the derivative, using only sign. Signs are sufficient to find and detect bracketing conditions. When the solution is bracketed, the next iteration always tests the midpoint.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Fails.:class: A wrapper for a line search cursor which tracks the best-known point.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.LineS.:class: A mutable cursor which represents a 1-d optimization problem.
A mutable cursor which represents a 1-d optimization problem.
A particular point in a LayerBase line search phase. Contains both the high-dimensional position and derivative, and the simplified one-dimensional positiion and derivative.
Base interface for providing a solver for line search problems.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Quadr.:class: The type Quadratic line search apply.

This exact line search method uses a linear interpolation of the derivative to find the extrema, where dx/dy = 0. Bracketing conditions are established apply logic that largely ignores derivatives, due to heuristic observations.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Simpl.:class: A basic line search cursor representing a linear parametric path.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line.Stati.:class: A very basic line search which uses a static rate, searching lower rates when iterations do not result in improvement.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Des.:class: This wrapper adds extra logging to the orientation step.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Gra.:class: The most basic type of orientation, which uses the raw function gradient.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.LBF.:class: An implementation of the Limited-Memory BroydenFletcherGoldfarbShanno algorithm https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited-memory_BFGS

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Lay.:class: This wrapping strategy alters the (Simple)LineCursor returned by the heapCopy strategy to effectively tune the learning rate for each layer.
The type Hash map layer reweighting strategy.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Mom.:class: A simple momentum module which uses a cumulative decay algorithm to add a momentum term to any orientation strategy (if it yields a SimpleLineSearch cursor)

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Ori.:class: Base class for the "orientation" optimization sub-component. This class interprets the result of the differential function evaluation result at the start of a training iteration, transforming the multi-dimensional point-vector-function entity into a one-dimensional search sub-problem.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Owl.:class: Orthant-Wise Limited-memory Quasi-Newton optimization This is a modified L-BFGS algorithm which uses orthant trust regions to bound the cursor path during the line search phase of each iteration

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.QQN.:class: Quadratic Quasi-Newton optimization This method hybridizes pure gradient descent apply higher-order quasinewton implementations such as L-BFGS. During each iteration, a quadratic curve is interpolated which aligns apply the gradient's direction prediction and intersects apply the quasinewton's optimal point prediction. A simple parameteric quadratic function blends both heapCopy cursors into a simple nonlinear path which should combine the stability of both methods.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Qua.:class: An orientation wrapper which adds additional log statements.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Rec.:class: An recursive optimization strategy which projects the current space into a reduced-dimensional subspace for a sub-optimization batch apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Tru.:class: A generalization of the OWL-QN algorithm, this wrapping strategy projects an heapCopy cursor to the interior of a trust region, which can be defined per-layer. Any simple orientation strategy can be used as the heapCopy, most commonly either GD or LBFGS. Many trust regions can be defined; see the com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region package.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient.Val.:class: This strategy uses finite-difference methods to estimate a numerical derivative, and compares it apply the derivative supplied by the heapCopy's cursor. This is a diagnostic tool; extra processing is used to estimate derivatives which should agree apply the programmatic derivatives to an appropriate degree.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Ada.:class: This trust region uses recent position history to define an ellipsoid volume for the n+1 line search

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Com.:class: This combination region yields the effective itersection of the trust region volumes.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Dis.:class: This constraint ensures that the L2 magnitude of the weight delta cannot exceed a simple threshold. A simpler version of AdaptiveTrustSphere, it places a limit on the step size for a given layer.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Gro.:class: This trust region restricts a weight vector so that it cannot increase in L2 magnitude beyond a certian amount each iteration. This effectively generates a spherical trust region centered on the origin apply the current position X distance into the sphere interior. A growth factor must be allowed for to provide convergence behavior so that the search algorithm can reach all possible weightings.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Lay.:class: A concrete class of the TrustRegion orientation strategy base class, this uses a map collection to store per-layer Trust Region configurations.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Lin.:class: This constrains a weight vector based on a single hyperplane which prevents immediate increases to the L1 magnitude. (Note: This region can allow effective L1 increases, if at least one weight changes sign; this allows for our entire search space to be reachable.)
The type Linear sum constraint apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Mea.:class: This highly-constrained region allows ONLY changes to the mean/stddev of the weight vector components. Experimental; no proven use case.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Pro.:class: This strict region allows only raw scaling of weights; it is similar to but more constrained than MeanVarianceGradient

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Ran.:class: This constraint ensures that the L2 magnitude of the weight delta cannot exceed a simple threshold. A simpler version of AdaptiveTrustSphere, it places a limit on the step size for a given layer.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Sin.:class: A Single-orthant trust region. These are used in OWL-QN to proven effect in training sparse models where an exact value of zero for many weights is desired.
The type Single orthant trust region apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Sta.:class: This type of trust region prevents any change the the given weight vector.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.region.Tru.:class: The base class for the component representing the trust region volumes used for optimization. This interface provides optional use of a position history, describing previous iterations' position, along apply the current position. These states can be used to define the relevant trust region. The trust region is implemented as a projection function which ensures a candidate state is either within the trust region volume, or on the boundary. If projection is needed, it must end up at the boundary and it must be the closest point, apply the vector from the input to point point being normal to the trust region surface at the position of the output.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.trainable..:class: The type Simple gradient descent apply.
The type Simple stochastic gradient descent apply.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.NotebookR.:class: The type Notebook output apply base.
The type Simple notebook report base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.data.CIFA.:class: Mirrored from https://www.cs.toronto.edu/~kriz/cifar.html For more information, and for citation, please see: Learning Multiple Layers of Features from Tiny Images, Alex Krizhevsky, 2009. https://www.cs.toronto.edu/~kriz/learning-features-2009-TR.pdf
The type Image classifier apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.data.Calt.:class: Caltech 101 Images When using, please cite: L. Fei-Fei, R. Fergus and P. Perona. Learning generative visual models from few training examples: an incremental Bayesian approach tested on 101 object categories. IEEE. CVPR 2004, Workshop on Generative-Model Based Vision. 2004 For more information see http://www.vision.caltech.edu/Image_Datasets/Caltech101
The type Image classifier apply base.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.data.Imag.:class: The type Image category dataset demo.

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.data.MNIS.:class: References: [LeCun et al., 1998a] Y. LeCun, L. Bottou, Y. Bengio, and P. Haffner. "Gradient-based learning applied to document recognition." Proceedings of the IEEE, 86(11):2278-2324, November 1998. See Also: http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist

com.simiacryptus.mindseye.test.data.MNis.:class: The type Image classifier apply base.
